title: The One With the Stoned Guy

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler's job, Chandler is typing data into his computer, he keeps typing even
while taking a drink of coffee with one hand. One of his co-workers walks by.]

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Mrs. Tedlock. You're looking lovely today. And may I say, that is a very flattering sleeve length on you.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. TEDLOCK
dialogue.text: Yes. Well, Mr. Kostelick wants you to stop by his office at the end of the day.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, listen. If this is about those prank memos, I had nothing to do with them. Really. Nothing at all. Really. (Chandler tries to hide a rubber chicken from the woman.) Nothing.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler's job, Chandler is typing data into his computer, he keeps typing even
while taking a drink of coffee with one hand. One of his co-workers walks by.]

events.event_description: Chandler types data into his computer while drinking coffee with one hand.
Mrs. Tedlock approaches Chandler and addresses him.
Mrs. Tedlock comments on Chandler's appearance and sleeve length.
Mrs. Tedlock informs Chandler that Mr. Kostelick wants him to visit his office at the end of the day.
Chandler denies involvement in prank memos and tries to hide a rubber chicken from Mrs. Tedlock.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there but Chandler. Phoebe runs in, excitedly.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey you guys! Chandler's coming and he says he has, like, this incredible news, so when he gets here, we could all act like, you know...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Never mind. But it was going to be really good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, it's a typical day at work. I'm inputting my numbers, and big Al calls me into his office and tells me he wants to make me processing supervisor.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: That's great!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So.... I quit.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why? This was supposed to be a temp job!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, Chandler... you've been there for five years.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If I took this promotion, it'd be like admitting that this is what I actually do.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So was it a lot more money?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It doesn't matter. I just don't want to be one of those guys that's in his office until twelve o'clock at night worrying about the WENUS.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ... the WENUS?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Weekly Estimated Net Usage Systems. A processing term.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Oh. That WENUS.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So what're you going to do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't know. That's the thing. I don't know what I want to do. I just know I'm not going to figure it out working there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oooh! I have something you can do! I have this new massage client... Steve? (pause) Anyway, he's opening up a restaurant and he's looking for a head chef.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (taps Phoebe on her shoulder) Um... hi there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi! (turns back to Chandler, then to Monica) Oh, yeah, no, I know. You're a chef. I know, and I thought of you first, but um, Chandler's the one who needs a job right now, so....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah... I just don't have that much cheffing experience. Unless it's an all-toast restaurant.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Monica's tapping) Yeah, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, what kind of food is he looking for?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he wants to do some ecclectic, so he's looking for someone who can, you know, create the entire menu.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (excited) Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know! (turns to Chandler) So, what do you think?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks, Phoebe. But I just don't really see myself in a big white hat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: OK. (pause) Oh Monica! Guess what!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there but Chandler. Phoebe runs in, excitedly.]

events.event_description: Phoebe runs into Central Perk, excitedly announcing that Chandler has news.
Chandler explains he was offered a promotion at work and decided to quit his job.
Chandler states he doesn't want to be working late at his current job and mentions the WENUS system.
Rachel sarcastically asks about the WENUS system, and Chandler explains it is a processing term.
Phoebe suggests Chandler could be a head chef for a restaurant opening, but Monica indicates she is a chef.
Phoebe expresses interest in Monica creating a menu for the restaurant.
Monica shows excitement about the restaurant idea.
Phoebe turns back to Chandler to ask for his opinion on the restaurant job.
Chandler declines the restaurant job, saying he doesn't see himself in a chef's hat.
Phoebe excitedly exclaims to Monica about something happening, indicating a new development.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler walks in, wearing a suit.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can you see my nipples through this shirt?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. But don't worry, I'm sure they're still there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where are you going, Mr. Suity-Man?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I have an appointment to see Dr. Robert Pillman, career counselor a-gogo. (pause) I added the "a-gogo."

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Career counselor?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you guys all know what you want to do.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, you guys in the living room all know what you want to do. You know, you have goals. You have dreams. I don't have a dream.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, the lesser-known "I don't have a dream" speech.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I love my life, I love my life!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! Brian's Song !

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: The meeting with the guy went great?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So great! He showed me where the restaurant's going to be. It's this, it's this cute little place on 10th Street. Not too big, not too small. Just right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Was it formerly owned by a blonde woman and some bears?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So anyway, I'm cooking dinner for him Monday night. You know, kind of like an audition. And Phoebe, he really wants you to be here, which will be great for me because then you can 'ooh' and 'ahh' and make yummy noises.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What are you going to make?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (as though Rachel wasn't paying attention) Yummy noises.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (pause) And Monica, what are you going to make?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't know. I don't know. It's just going to be so great!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! I know what you could make! (runs over to join Monica and Rachel in the kitchen) I know! Oh, you should definitely make that thing... you know, with the stuff? (Monica doesn't know.) You know, that thing... with the stuff...? OK, I don't know. (sits down)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey guys, does anybody know a good date place in the neighborhood?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How about Tony's? If you can finish a 32-ounce steak, it's free.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, ahem, hey, does anybody know a good place if you're not dating a puma?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Who are you going out with?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, is this the bug lady?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (trying to sound like a bug) Bzzzz.... I love you, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Her name is Celia. She's not a bug lady. She's curator of insects at the museum.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So what are you guys going to do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I just thought we could go out to dinner, and then maybe bring her back to my place and I'd introduce her to my monkey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And he's not speaking metaphorically.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (aside to Ross) So.... back to your place...you thinking, maybe... (gestures with hands, back and forth) huh-huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know.... (gestures) huh-huh.... but I'm hoping (gestures) huh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, that monkey is a chick magnet! She's going to take one look at his furry, cute little face and it'll seal the deal.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler walks in, wearing a suit.]

events.event_description: Chandler walks into Monica and Rachel's apartment wearing a suit.
Chandler asks Rachel if she can see his nipples through his shirt.
Rachel responds that she cannot see Chandler's nipples but assures him they are still there.
Phoebe asks Chandler where he is going, referring to him as 'Mr. Suity-Man'.
Chandler states he has an appointment with Dr. Robert Pillman, a career counselor, adding 'a-gogo'.
Rachel questions Chandler about his career counseling appointment.
Chandler comments that everyone in the living room knows what they want to do, implying he does not have a clear goal.
Ross sarcastically remarks about Chandler's 'I don't have a dream' speech.
Monica expresses her love for her life.
Phoebe excitedly mentions 'Brian's Song', indicating her enthusiasm for the movie.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's apartment, Marcel is hanging from Celia's hair, and she is screaming,
trying to get him off.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Celia, don't worry! Don't scream! He's not going to hurt you! Soothing tones, Celia. Soothing tones! Marcel...

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: I can't stand this! He's got his claws in my...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright... (lifts Marcel away)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross's apartment, Marcel is hanging from Celia's hair, and she is screaming,
trying to get him off.]

events.event_description: Celia screams while Marcel hangs from her hair, struggling to get him off.
Ross notices Celia is distressed and speaks to her to calm her down.
Ross reassures Celia that Marcel will not hurt her and instructs her to use soothing tones.
Ross lifts Marcel away from Celia's hair to free her.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there but Ross and Chandler. Monica is making
food, and having everyone try it.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Joey) OK, try this salmon mousse.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (tasting) Mmmm. Good.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is it better than the other salmon mousse?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's creamier.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, is that better ?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know. We're talking about whipped fish, Monica. I'm just happy I'm keeping it down, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: My God! What happened to you?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Eight and a half hours of aptitude tests, intelligence tests, personality tests... and what do I learn? (he taps the results and reads them) "You are ideally suited for a career in data processing for a large multinational corporation."

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That's so great! 'Cause you already know how to do that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Can you believe it? I mean, don't I seem like somebody who should be doing something really cool ? You know, I just always pictured myself doing something...something.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (comes up and rubs him on the chest) Oh Chandler, I know, I know... oh, hey! You can see your nipples through this shirt!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (brings a plate of tiny appetizers over) Here you go, maybe this'll cheer you up.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh, you know, I had a grape about five hours ago, so I'd better split this with you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's supposed to be that small. It's a pre-appetizer. The French call it an amouz-bouche.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (tastes it) Well.... it is amouz-ing...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) Oh, hi Wendy! (Listens) Yeah, eight o'clock. (Listens) What did we say? Ten dollars an hour?... (Listens) OK, great. (Listens) All right, I'll see you then. Bye. (hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ten dollars an hour for what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, I asked one of the waitresses at work if she'd help me out.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (hurt) Waitressing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh-oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well... of course I thought of you! But... but...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: But, but?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: But, you see, it's just... this night has to go just perfect, you know? And, well, Wendy's more of a... professional waitress.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! I see. And I've sort of been maintaining my amateur status so that I can waitress in the Olympics.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, I don't mean to brag, but I waited tables at Innsbruck in '76. (dead silence) Amouz-bouche ? (holds out tray)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there but Ross and Chandler. Monica is making
food, and having everyone try it.]

events.event_description: Monica offers Joey a sample of salmon mousse to taste.
Joey tastes the salmon mousse and comments that it is good.
Monica asks Joey if the salmon mousse is better than her previous batch.
Joey responds that the mousse is creamier, implying a comparison.
Monica questions if creamier equals better in the salmon mousse.
Joey admits he doesn't know if creamier is better and comments on the difficulty of eating whipped fish.
Chandler receives his aptitude and personality test results and reads that he is suited for data processing.
Phoebe expresses happiness about Chandler's test results, implying he is suited for a data processing career.
Chandler questions whether he appears suited for something 'really cool' and expresses a desire for a different career.
Monica brings a plate of tiny appetizers to the group and explains they are pre-appetizers called 'amouz-bouche' in French.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross' apartment, Girl, You'll Be A Woman Soon (the original, not that
cruddy Urge Overkill version) is playing. Ross and Celia are kissing passionately.]

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: Talk to me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK.... um, a weird thing happened to me on the train this morning...

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: No no no. Talk... dirty.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (embarrassed) Wha... what, here?

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: Yes...

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: Say something..... hot .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (panicked) Er.... um.....

dialogue.speaker: CELIA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um... uh.... vulva.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross' apartment, Girl, You'll Be A Woman Soon (the original, not that
cruddy Urge Overkill version) is playing. Ross and Celia are kissing passionately.]

events.event_description: Celia instructs Ross to talk dirty to her.
Ross begins to speak about a strange incident on the train.
Celia urges Ross to speak more explicitly and passionately.
Ross, feeling embarrassed, questions if he should speak such words here.
Celia insists that Ross continue and speak openly.
Ross panics and attempts to say something, eventually uttering the word 'vulva'.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Ross are there, discussing what happened last
night.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (in disbelief) Vulva ?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, I panicked, alright? She took me by surprise. You know, but it wasn't a total loss. I mean, we ended up cuddling.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Whoaa!! You cuddled? How many times??

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Shut up! It was nice. I just... I don't think I'm the dirty-talking kind of guy, you know?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What's the big deal? You just say what you want to do to her. Or what you want her to do to you. Or what you think other people might be doing to each other. I'll tell you what. Just try something on me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (deadpan) Please be kidding.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why not? Come on! Just, just close your eyes and tell me what you'd like to be doing right now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK. (closes eyes) I'm in my apartment...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ....yeah... what else?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's it. I'm in my apartment, you're not there, we're not having this conversation. (gets up, walks across room)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (walks to catch up to him) Alright, look, I'll start, OK?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey, please.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on. Come on. Alright, ready, look! (in a low voice) Oh... Ross.... you get me so hot. I want your lips on me now .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (impressed) Wow.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright, now you say something.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I... ahem... I really don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on! You like this woman, right?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You want to see her again, right?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sure.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well if you can't talk dirty to me, how're you going to talk dirty to her? Now tell me you want to caress my butt!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: OK, turn around. (Joey looks taken aback) I just don't want you staring at me when I'm doing this.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (turning around) Alright, alright. I'm around. Go ahead.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ahem... I want.... OK, I want to... feel your... hot, soft skin with my lips.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: There you go! Keep going. Keep going!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I, er...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I want to take my tongue... and...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Say it... say it!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...run it all over your body until you're... trembling with... with...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (smiling)....with??

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (rushing to explain) Funny story!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You're not going to believe this!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's OK. It's OK. I was always rooting for you two kids to get together.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey Chandler, while you were sleeping that guy from your old job called again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Again?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And again, and again, and again... (phone rings, he answers) Hello? (hands phone to Chandler) And again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hey Mr. Kostelic! How's life on the fifteenth floor? (Listens) Yeah, I miss you too. (Listens) Yeah, it's a lot less satisfying to steal pens from your own home, you know? (Listens) Well, that's very generous (Listens) er, but look, this isn't about the money. I need something that's more than a job. I need something I can really care about.... (Listens) And that's on top of the yearly bonus structure you mentioned earlier? (Listens) Look, Al, Al... I'm not playing hardball here, OK? This is not a negotiation, this is a rejection! (Listens) No! No! No, stop saying numbers! I'm telling you, you've got the wrong guy! You've got the wrong guy! (Listens) I'll see you on Monday! (slams the phone down)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Ross are there, discussing what happened last
night.]

events.event_description: Ross admits to Joey that he panicked during a recent encounter and ended up cuddling with a woman.
Joey sarcastically questions Ross about how many times he cuddled with the woman.
Ross expresses that he is not the type to talk dirty and prefers to keep things simple.
Joey encourages Ross to practice talking dirty by imagining a scenario where they are alone in his apartment.
Joey initiates a role-play where he asks Ross to say what he would like to do to him, prompting Ross to describe feeling Joey's lips and skin.
Ross attempts to describe running his tongue over Joey's body, leading to Joey encouraging him to continue.
Ross quickly tries to explain that his previous statement was a joke, as Joey reacts with surprise.
Chandler comments on his support for Ross and Joey's interaction, indicating he was aware of their relationship.
Joey informs Chandler about a phone call from his former boss, which Chandler answers, leading to a humorous exchange about job rejection.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's new window office, he is showing Phoebe around.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (excited) Wow! It's huge! It's so much bigger than the cubicle. Oh, this is a cube.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look at this! (he opens the curtain to a view of New York City)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! You have a window!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes indeedy! (they look outside) With a beautiful view of...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh look! That guy's peeing!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (walks away from window) OK, that's enough of the view. Check this out, look at this. Sit down, sit down.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sitting) OK.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This is great! (he presses a button on his intercom) Helen, could you come in here for a moment?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank you Helen, that'll be all.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Last time I do that, I promise.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler's new window office, he is showing Phoebe around.]

events.event_description: Chandler shows Phoebe around his new office, highlighting its size and features.
Chandler opens the curtain to reveal a view of New York City.
Phoebe notices and comments on a man peeing outside the window.
Chandler walks away from the window to stop looking at the view.
Chandler presses a button on his intercom to call Helen into the office.
Chandler thanks Helen for coming into the office.
Chandler makes a humorous remark about the last time he used the intercom.
Chandler invites Phoebe to sit down and shows enthusiasm about the office features.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is on the phone. Rachel walks in and overhears the
conversation.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (shouting on phone) Wendy, we had a deal! (Listens) Yeah, you promised! Wendy! Wendy! Wendy! (hangs up)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who was that?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wendy bailed. I have no waitress.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh... that's too bad. Bye bye. (she walks away towards the door)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ten dollars an hour.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Twelve dollars an hour.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon. I wish I could, but I've made plans to walk around.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, Rachel, when you ran out of your wedding, I was there for you. I put a roof over your head, and if that means nothing to you... (Rachel isn't buying it, desperate) twenty dollars an hour.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Done.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is on the phone. Rachel walks in and overhears the
conversation.]

events.event_description: Monica answers her phone and shouts at Wendy about a failed deal.
Monica hangs up the phone after expressing frustration about Wendy bailing.
Rachel enters the scene and asks Monica about the caller.
Monica informs Rachel that Wendy has bailed and she has no waitress.
Rachel responds sympathetically and prepares to leave.
Monica offers Rachel a wage of ten dollars an hour to work as a waitress.
Rachel declines Monica's initial offer.
Monica increases her wage offer to twelve dollars an hour.
Monica appeals to Rachel's sense of loyalty and past support, mentioning her own sacrifices.
Rachel agrees to Monica's wage offer of twenty dollars an hour.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later. Rachel is waitressing, Monica is cooking. Phoebe
walks in with Steve ( Crystal Duck winner Jon Lovitz).]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well hello! Welcome to Monica's. May I take your coat?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi Steve!

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Hello, Monica. (to Rachel) Hello, greeter girl.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Steve) This is Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (unconcerned) Yeah, OK.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (overemphasizing) Mmmmmm! Everything smells so delicious! You know, I can't remember a time I smelt such a delicious combination of (Monica signals her to stop) of, OK, smells.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: It's a lovely apartment.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you. Would you like a tour?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: I was just being polite, but, alright.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What's up?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (whispers) In the cab, on the way over, Steve blazed up a doobie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Smoked a joint? You know, lit a bone? Weed? Hemp? Ganja?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: OK, OK. I'm with you, Cheech. OK.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (from the living room) Is it dry in here? (licks his lips)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Let me, let me get you some wine!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, I think we're ready for our first course. (Steve sits, Monica brings over a tray) OK, um, these are rot-shrimp ravioli, and celantro pondou sauce... (Steve starts to eat them one by one, quickly)... with just a touch of mints... and... (he finishes)... ginger.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Well, smack my ass and call me Judy! These are fantastic!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm so glad you liked them!

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Like 'em? I could eat a hundred of them!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, well... um, that's all there are of these. But in about eight and a half minutes, we'll be serving some delicious onion tartlets.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Tartlets. Tartlets. Tartlets. The word has lost all meaning. (he gets up and goes into the kitchen)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Excuse me? Can I help you with anything?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: You know, I don't know what I'm looking for.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (from kitchen) Ah, cool! Taco shells! (Rachel motions, "You see!") You know, these are... they're like a little corn envelope.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (joining him and taking the taco shells) You know that? You don't want to spoil your appetite.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (looking in cabinets) Hey! Sugar-O's! (grabs the cereal box)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know, if you just wait another... six and a half minutes...

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Macaroni and cheese! We gotta make this!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, we don't. (reaches for box)

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Oh, OK. (he drops the box on the floor) Oh, sorry. (When she bends down to pick it up he grabs a package of Gummi-bears from the cabinet.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why don't you just have a seat here? (he sits at the table, then tries to secretly eat the Gummi-bears. Monica spots him.) OK... give me the Gummi-bears.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (childishly) No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Give them to me.

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Alright, we'll share.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, give me the...

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Well then you can't have any. (she grabs for the package, and it breaks open. Gummi-bears fly everywhere, some into the punch bowl on the table.) Bear overboard! I think he's drowning. (he throws some Sugar-O's into the punch bowl) Hey fellows! Grab on a Sugar-O... save yourself! (Mimicking the bears) "Help! I'm drowning! Help!"

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (furious) That's it! Dinner is over!

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Why?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? It's just that I've waited seven years for an opportunity like this, and you can't even wait four and a half minutes for a stupid onion tartlet?

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: (excited) Hey!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later. Rachel is waitressing, Monica is cooking. Phoebe
walks in with Steve ( Crystal Duck winner Jon Lovitz).]

events.event_description: Rachel greets Steve and offers to take his coat at the door of Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Steve introduces himself to Monica and acknowledges Rachel as the greeter.
Phoebe comments on the delicious smell of the apartment, overemphasizing her statement.
Monica offers to give Steve a tour of the apartment.
Phoebe whispers to Rachel that Steve smoked a joint in the cab on the way over.
Steve tastes the rot-shrimp ravioli and comments positively on their flavor.
Steve begins to eat the ravioli quickly, finishing the dish.
Steve expresses enthusiasm for the ravioli, saying he could eat a hundred.
Steve goes into the kitchen to look for more food, grabbing taco shells and cereal from the cabinets.
Steve secretly tries to eat Gummi-bears from a package, which Monica notices and demands he give her the Gummi-bears.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all are there except Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What a tool!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You don't want to work for a guy like that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know... it's just... I thought this was, you know... it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, you'll get there. You're an amazing chef.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah! You know all those yummy noises? I wasn't faking.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Ross) So, er... how did it go with Celia?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I was unbelievable.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, Ross!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I was the James Michener of dirty talk. It was the most elaborate filth you have ever heard. I mean, there were characters, plot lines, themes, a motif... at one point there were villagers.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa! And the... (gestures with hands) huh-huh?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, ahem... you know, by the time we'd finished with all the dirty talk, it was kinda late... and we were both kind of exhausted, so uh...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You cuddled.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, which was nice.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You guys wanna try and catch a late movie or something?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Maybe, but shouldn't we wait for Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, where the hell is he?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all are there except Chandler.]

events.event_description: Joey comments on someone being a tool.
Rachel expresses disapproval of working for a certain person.
Ross agrees with Rachel about the situation.
Monica shares her feelings about her job situation.
Ross reassures Monica that she will succeed as a chef.
Phoebe comments on the authenticity of her 'yummy noises'.
Joey asks Ross about his experience with Celia.
Ross describes his experience with Celia as elaborate and theatrical.
Ross humorously compares his dirty talk with Celia to a story with characters, plot lines, and themes.
Joey observes that Ross's dirty talk involved villagers and gestures with his hands.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's office, he's on the phone, agitated.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (on phone) Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I'm looking at the WENUS and I'm not happy!... (Listens) Oh, really, really, really? Well, let me tell you something... you will care about it, because I care about it! You got it? Good! (slams phone down, then leans back and realizes what just happened) Whooooaaaa....

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler's office, he's on the phone, agitated.]

events.event_description: Chandler answers the phone in his office and begins speaking to Fran.
Chandler expresses dissatisfaction about the WENUS while on the phone.
Chandler listens to Fran on the phone, reacting to her comments.
Chandler confronts Fran about her attitude, asserting that she will care about the WENUS because he cares.
Chandler slams the phone down in frustration.
Chandler leans back in his chair and realizes what just happened.
Chandler exclaims 'Whooooaaaa...' indicating surprise or realization.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe's massage parlour, she has Steve on the table, and is giving him an
extra-painful massage.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: How's this? (presses down hard)

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Eeeee!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sorry. How about over here? (presses down hard again)

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Aaaaah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: See, that just means it's working. Does this hurt? (presses down elsewhere)

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What about this? (she starts using her elbows on his back, he yells in pain)

dialogue.speaker: STEVE
dialogue.text: Aaaaahhh!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: There you go! (She continues to work him over with her elbows and he continues to yell in pain.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Phoebe's massage parlour, she has Steve on the table, and is giving him an
extra-painful massage.]

events.event_description: Phoebe presses down hard on Steve's back during the massage.
Steve yells in pain as Phoebe presses down hard on his back.
Phoebe presses down hard on Steve's back again.
Steve yells in pain as Phoebe presses down hard on his back.
Phoebe asks Steve if the massage hurts after pressing down elsewhere.
Steve responds that the massage does not hurt when she presses elsewhere.
Phoebe uses her elbows to press on Steve's back, causing him to yell in pain.
Steve yells in pain as Phoebe continues to press with her elbows.
Phoebe exclaims 'There you go!' as she continues the painful massage.
Phoebe continues to work on Steve with her elbows while he yells in pain.
